name: algolia-browse-records
description: Browse for records in the given index. [See the documentation](https://www.algolia.com/doc/libraries/javascript/v5/methods/search/browse/?client=javascript).

name: algolia-delete-records
description: Delete records from the given index. [See the documentation](https://www.algolia.com/doc/libraries/javascript/v5/helpers/#delete-records)

recordIds.description: IDs of the records to delete also known as `objectIDs`. Eg. `["1", "2"]`. If you don't know the IDs, you can use the **Browse Records** action to find them, then map them and then use them here as a custom expression. Eg. `{{steps.map_records_to_objectids.$return_value}}`.

name: algolia-save-records
description: Adds records to an index. [See the documentation](https://www.algolia.com/doc/libraries/javascript/v5/helpers/#save-records).

records.description: The records to add to the index. Each record should be a JSON object. Eg. `{"objectID": "1", "name": "Jane Doe"}`. For a better user experience, you can use the [**CSV File To Objects**](https://pipedream.com/apps/helper-functions/actions/csv-file-to-objects) **Helper Function** action to convert a CSV file to an array of objects and then map the objects to the records field here as a **Custom Expression**. Eg. `{{steps.csv_file_to_objects.$return_value}}`.
